ygData.subject: Re: Corpse Looting and other anti-social behavior
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello! ... Something interesting I have to add - while visiting paineel, the new home of my erudite necro, I tried to help an enchantress to get her corpse
ygData.messageBody:
Hello!

"Kimes, Dean W." wrote:

> One thing I always thought was strange. Why didn't Verant make corpse
> dragging dependent on a different permission than looting? Adding a /drag
> permission to the game wouldn't be all that difficult, then they could
> enable people to drag a corpse without being able to loot it. If that's too
> 'unrealistic' for them, why not do the following:
> /trust allows someone else to drag and loot your corpse.
> /consent allows someone to drag and loot your corpse without suffering
> penalties

Something interesting I have to add - while visiting paineel, the new
home of my erudite necro, I tried to help an enchantress to get her
corpse back from the city (deathtrap :).
The strange thing was that she gave me consent but when I tried to drag
I got "You dont have consent to summon the corpse" (!). Looting did work
and she got everything but a bag with a no drop item.
A guide/gm showed up on her petition and summoned the rest of her corpse
and stated that its a bug in paineel.
Well, this shows that imho there is already seperated functions for
summoning and looting so it should be VERY easy to stick a /function to
it :(

bye
tirc.
